DataElement.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Third Edition (CVLT-3) Trial B Correct Scaled Score Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric representation of the California Verbal Learning Test, Third Edition (CVLT-3) Trial B Correct Scaled Score.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Third Edition Trial B Correct Scaled Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The third published version of the California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years. This edition includes a new index that is designed to provide a more refined assessment of yes/no recognition memory by minimizing potential influences of source and semantic interference._An indication of the number of correct answers in trial B._Conversion of a raw score on a test to a common scale that allows for a numerical comparison.

ObjectClass.preferredName: California Verbal Learning Test - Third Edition
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The third published version of the California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years. This edition includes a new index that is designed to provide a more refined assessment of yes/no recognition memory by minimizing potential influences of source and semantic interference.

Concepts.longName: California Verbal Learning Test - Third Edition
Concepts.definition: The third published version of the California Verbal Learning Test, a neuropsychological test developed to make a comprehensive and detailed assessment of verbal learning and memory in individuals ranging in age from 16 to 89 years. This edition includes a new index that is designed to provide a more refined assessment of yes/no recognition memory by minimizing potential influences of source and semantic interference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A numerical quantity that indicates how far and in what direction an item deviates from its distribution's mean, expressed in units of standard deviation. Calculation of a z-score requires knowledge about the population's standard deviation and mean.
